#Text=Journalists escape after being kidnapped in Syria
#Text=Tuesday , December 18 , 2012
#Text=Video showing rocket strike near camera from a citizen journalist broadcasting live footage from Homs , Syria on February 9 .
#Text=Image : Baba-Omer via Bambuser .
#Text=At least two journalists were released after being held captive in Syria for approximately five days according to NBC News .
#Text=Turkish journalist Aziz Akyavaş and US journalist Richard Engel went missing on Thursday .
#Text=Both work for NBC News and were on assignment in the country .
#Text="

#Text=After being kidnapped and held for five days inside Syria by an unknown group , NBC News Chief Foreign Correspondent Richard Engel and his production crew members have been freed unharmed .

#Text=Earlier NTV , the Turkish language partner of MSNBC , reported Akyavaş may have been  arrested and detained in Syria "

column1: #Text=( ( tr))Turkish language : ‍Suriye'de tutuklanıp tutuklanmadığına , but they also added , " [ we ] do not have any information yet . "
#Text=( ( tr))Turkish language : ‍henüz herhangi bir bilgi yok
#Text=The Kuwait News Agency reported Akyavaş may have been kidnapped , but also reported Engel was the one who announced Akyavaş was missing .
#Text=The journalists went missing after crossing into Syria from the Turkish border .
#Text=NBC News says Engel and others were tied up , blindfolded , and put in the back of a truck and driven to possibly near the Syrian town of Ma’arrat Misrin .
#Text=When they were moved to another location , the kidnappers accidentally approached a Syrian rebel checkpoint and a gunfight broke out .
#Text=Two unnamed captors were killed in the attack , but Engel and others were able to escape .
#Text=No one has claimed responsibility for the kidnapping and no one was injured .
#Text=NBC News never had contact with their captors and a ransom demand was never made .
#Text=Little was initially known about the situation .

#Text=At first , NBC did n't officially acknowledge either of the journalists were missing and according to Gawker , they website was " subject to a news blackout — one to which Gawker agreed until now — for at least the past 24 hours . "
#Text=Engel is a regular user of the social networking website Twitter and has not posted a ' Tweet ' since December 6 .
#Text=His last official report was filed on December 11 .
#Text=In February , Wikinews reported journalists were apparently targeted in Syrian government attacks , and some of them killed .
#Text=On February 9 , a Syrian citizen journalist named ' Omar ' was airing a live feed of the bombardment of Homs when several rockets struck near the camera 's position , nearly destroying it .
#Text=On February 21 , a member of the Homs Media Center was killed by a rocket as Syrian forces continued their bombardment of the city for an eighteenth straight day .
#Text=A day later , Marie Colvin , a Sunday Times journalist , and award winning French photographer Rémi Ochlik , were killed when rockets again hit the media center .
#Text=At least two others were injured in the attack , French journalist Edith Bouvier and British photographer Paul Conroy .
